data.title: Whoa! Those biscuits and gravy were stellar.
data.text: I visited Joe's after church on Sunday. We made a reservation fearing a large crowd but we didn't need to. Although the place was packed, no one had to wait to be seated. The kitchen was well-organized and put out quality food fast. The waitstaff was friendly. I ordered the hot links and eggs with hash browns and biscuits and gravy. Everything was perfectly cooked (The hash browns were on the crispy side, however. That is the way I prefer them but some readers may like them a little less done.) What stood out were the biscuits and gravy. The gravy was not over-peppered like most restaurants in the Dallas scene. The biscuits were soft, yet firm enough to stand up to the gravy. In short, this was a perfectly executed side dish that really added an exclamation point to a great meal.

data.title: where Irving meets and eats
data.text:
Dang
is this place good or what?
It's better than good. So good I called in every day!
The owners - Carol and her daughter Tammy - are really friendly and love to chat to customers.
The food is excellent. Freshly cooked, generous portions and good value for money.

data.title: 1st and 2nd Times a Charm!
data.text: When visitingmy Uncle we always fit Joe's in for breakfast.  Great breakfast food (I recommend the French toast) and great friendly service.  Not only is the French toast good but also the eggs, bacon and hash browns are yummy.  Love the small town feel and love the friendly staff!  Joe's rocks!

data.title: Very good
data.text: Joe's is a staple in Irving,Tx always a great breakfast or lunch even dinner!! The staff is friendly and the food is great at a fair price I give how's a thumbs up!!

data.title: Generous portions, friendly staff
data.text: We made our first visit to Joe's a while back, since it's an Irving "institution". We quickly learned why: The staff is very friendly, the menu offerings ample, and the food just kept coming and coming! It was all very good, but we had to take our yummy pie portions to go.

data.title: decent homestyle breakfast
data.text: very busy place in the mornings, but that's what their name says. We usually do breakfast, but occasionally lunch, if in the area. Breakfast is best, though...

data.title: Not what i used to be...
data.text: Under new ownership and i's so bad that the old staff who worked there even left and opened their own coffee shop! The food at Joe's is not what it used to be and most of the staff is rude. It's a wonder the doors are still open.

data.title: Always good!
data.text: Had breakfast here and it's always good. Their omelets are really good with just the right amount of cheese and meat. I'm a grits lover and it s hard to get them right but Joe's always does. If your a breakfast person go here.

data.title: Good Country Breakfast
data.text: Went with some friends, the food was tasty, the gravy was a bit bland. Bacon was nice and crispy, eggs over easy were perfect, and the hash browns were really good. Our waitress was funny, engaging and johnny on the spot when coffee or juice got low.

data.title: Texas Diner from my youth
data.text: From the wise cracking waitress to the down home feel, this was a great meal of chicken fried steak, mashed potatoes, green beans, salad with blue cheese and a home made pie for dessert.   Very Casual Diner found no where else in the Irving Area.  Very Reasonable Prices with an all you can eat special.  My wife likes the Liver & Onions, and we both like the Chicken & Dumplings.

data.title: Work flow lunch
data.text: The lunch specials offer a variety.  Today was my lucky day chicken and dumplings were hot and good. The service was good. I was seated immediately and my order was taken and delivered quickly.  This is a great place to dine and get back to work

data.title: Superb Service and Above Average Food
data.text: The minute you step in you get the feeling that people like what they are doing  - not the usual 'eat up and leave' that you find with other diners.  Recommend the Vegetable Plate and the pie

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: short wait despite long line of hungry people, friendly, clean and good home cooking.  Would make sure to stop by again when in the area.

data.title: You're Only a Stranger Here Once
data.text: Joe's is everything you want in a small town family restaurant with Texas character. Wait staff is very friendly and make you feel right at home, yet they are fast and professional. Food is always delicious; it's the next best thing to a real, home-cooked family dinner. Portions are ample and the prices are unbeatable -- especially for the quality of the food. The special is always a good bet, as are the pies. If you're looking for rib-sticking comfort food, plenty of variety, and a down-home good experience, Joe's will not disappoint. You can go a lot fancier in the area, but you can't get a better overall value for your time and money. A word of caution: those who aren't familiar with Texas hospitality might mistake the jovial good humor of the wait staff as rudeness. There's NOTHING formal about Joe's. If you're looking for celebrity treatment, you'll find Joe's is a lot more like going home and being embraced by the love and good-natured ribbing of your siblings.

data.title: Good food and friendly service
data.text:
My friends and I were brought to Joe's on our first night in Texas for a business meeting.  One of the en we were with is a regular there.  It is a simple menu, with delicious comfort food type fare.  One of the specials was chicken fried steak and since it came highly recommended that's what I got!  It came with a trip to the salad bar, choice of potato, 2 vegetables, rolls, and dessert.  I had French fries, corn fritters, and another vegetable that I can't think of now.  All were very good.  I do recommend the option of the salad bar with the food bar, which I would try if I went there again. That night the  food bar had chicken and dumplings which looked very good.   Our friend recommended that if we were going to have dessert to try one of the many varieties of pie.  He recommended the cherry or strawberry cheesecake pies specifically, so I had the strawberry! It was very tasty!  Even the crust was very good.  Everyone in our party (about 8 of us) had pie, and one of the guys was very surprised to find out they had 4 types of sugar free pie!  He had the coconut and enjoyed it very much.  
On a side note, the waitresses were very nice, friendly, and helpful for people who couldn't make up their mind!  I would go back to Joe's any time I go to Texas!

data.title: Wonderful Mom & Pop Stop!
data.text: The ladies at Joe's are very welcoming and nice. I love the corn fritters and daily fresh pies. Catfish on Friday is great too. Its an Irving local favorite. Never crowded. You can order off the menu or take advantage of the ever changing buffet.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Really good chicken fried steaks, burgers, breakfasts, and.............great breakfast food as well.  Great selection of delicious pies.

data.title: Incredible pie!
data.text:
Being from England, this felt like a real Texan diner experience for us! The food was simple and home cooked, but tasty. Staff were really friendly and even though we arrived just before closing, we didn't feel rushed or as if they were keen for us to leave.

Make sure you leave room for pie - they are amazing! We had a slice of chocolate and a slice of strawberry cream cheese. If we weren't leaving Dallas the next day, we'd definitely have been back for more!

data.title: Great Modest Place
data.text:
The place isn't fancy, and frankly I love that about it.  I get so tired of places trying to be "trendy" and charging extreme prices.  It's nice to have a place to sit and relax.  The wait staff is just great, very friendly and always attentive.  Honestly, I really like the atmosphere

My wife and I have gone about 4 times now, and so far each time was great!  I've seen reviews about food being overcooked, but not that I noticed.  My home-style fries were a bit well cooked one time though.  Probably depends on who's cooking I guess.  

Honestly, the best thing to me is coming here for supper, ordering something with the salad bar for one of the sides, and getting out of there nice and stuffed for $15 for two.  Honestly this seems to be our only place we've been eating out at lately, besides going out for sushi.

data.title: Best Pie Place in Town
data.text: This is a family eatery immediately on the western edge of downtown.  Locals see this place as a local place to meet their friends and eat the best pie in town.  Visitors see it as a hometown cooking icon.  The food is good for an appropriate price.  Diner atmosphere.
